description.narrative: To improve the quality of life for families that are at risk of social and environmental marginalization through implementing water infrastructure, health, and production activities. The community targeted with this project struggles to collect water throughout the year (as a result of flooding and drought cycles) and often resort to drawing water from a contaminated pond. This project will build a rainwater catchment and storage system that will help alleviate this problem by capturing 30,000 liters of rainwater per year. ASSEMA will implement a waste management project by installing 3 bio-digester systems that will turn human waste in the three test sites into organic fertilizer to be used for agricultural purposes. The final initiatives supported by this grant are to ensure food security by implementing three poultry production units, one rice processing machine that can serve the needs of 195 people in the community, and then work on establishing longer water, health, and agricultural management system for the community
